text: This is a list of professional wrestlers, managers and other workers that were employed in World Wrestling Entertainment from: * 1952–1963 (as the Capitol Wrestling Corporation) * 1963–1979 (as the World Wide Wrestling Federation) * 1979–2002 (as the World Wrestling Federation) * 2002–2011 (as World Wrestling Entertainment) * 2011-present (as WWE) ==Alumni== Name: Ring name(s): Tenure: Notes Mike Adamle 2008–2009 Brian Adams Crush Demolition Crush Kona Crush 1990–1995, 1996–1997, 2001 Brooke Brooke Adams 2006–2007 Kerry Von Erich Texas Tornado 1990–1992 Lacey Von Erich Aaron Aguilera Conquistador Uno Jesús Jesús Aguilera "Captain" Lou Albano 1960–1961, 1964, 1967–1986, 1994–1995 Brakkus Brent Albright Gunner Scott Mike Awesome Armando Alejandro Estrada Armando Estrada Billy White Wolf General Adnan 1976–1977, 1990–1991 Ken Anderson Ken Kennedy Mr. Anderson Mr. Kennedy Eric Angle Kurt Angle Manu Afa 1979–1980, 1982–1984, 1992–1995 Sika 1979–1980, 1982–1984, 1986–1988 Tahitian Savage Tahitian Warrior 1993, 1995–1996 Rosey 1996, 2001–2006 Yokozuna 1992–1997 Sammy the Silk Samu Samula 1983–1984, 1992–1994, 1995–1996 Buddy Landel TL Hopper Uncle Cletus Joey Abs 1994–1998, 1999–2001 Último Dragón Max Moon Latin Fury MVP Montel Vontavious Porter Bob Backlund Buff Bagwell The Ox Arkansas Ox Ox Baker 1967, 1980 "Rugged" Ronnie Garvin Boris Zhukov Pat Barrett 1963, 1975–1976 Rob Bartlett 1993 Doug Basham Nicole Bass Batista Dave Batista Deacon Bautista 2000–2010 Candice Michelle Rene Goulet Ivan Putski Scott Putski Jazz Redd Dogg Rodney Mack Shelton Benjamin Chris Benoit Bam Bam Bigelow Dynamite Kid Paul Burchill The Ripper Eric Bischoff Steve Blackman 1997–2002 B. Anderson Sapphire 1989–1990 The Boogeyman Lena Yada Itsuki Yamazaki Itsuki Yamazaki 1987–1988 Brian Knobs 1990–1993 Taka Michinoku 1997–2002 Ricky Ortiz Akio Jimmy Wang Yang Yang Tom Zenk ==Died while under contract== Date of Death Real Name Ring Name(s) Notes Reference November 22, 1954 Roderick McMahon Jess McMahon He promoted until his death. June 11, 1976 Toots Mondt Toots Mondt Died after a long illness. July 4, 1994 Joey Marella Joey Marella Died after he fell asleep at the wheel of his vehicle and crashed. October 5, 1997 Brian Pillman Brian Pillman A previously undetected heart condition led to his death. May 23, 1999 Owen Hart Owen Hart, The Blue Blazer Fell to his death while being lowered to the ring from the catwalk of the Kemper Arena October 6, 1999 Robert Marella Gorilla Monsoon Died of heart failure after being ill. He was given lifetime employment. November 13, 2005 Eddie Guerrero Eddie Guerrero Died of an acute heart failure, caused by undiagnosed arteriosclerotic cardiovascular disease. June 25, 2007 Chris Benoit Chris Benoit Death ruled a double murder-suicide after he killed his wife and child. November 2, 2007 Lillian Ellison Fabulous Moolah Cause of death not yet released. August 24, 2023 Windham Rotunda Duke Rotundo Husky Harris Bray Wyatt "The Fiend" Bray Wyatt The Fiend Died from heart attack while sleeping. Had been on medical hiatus in February 2023 because of COVID-19 which increased an already existing heart condition. ==Related pages== * List of World Wrestling Entertainment employees ==References== ==Other websites== * WWE alumni at WWE.com * WWE alumni by decade at onlineworldofwrestling.com Category:Lists of professional wrestlers *
